Parents,
The Parent Portal Grade Viewer system has recently been updated. There are a few things you need to be aware of. Please see below.

There is no need to sign up for a new account.
Your username and password will remain the same.

This means if you did not provide the email on beginning-of-the-year paperwork that matches the email you used to create your Parent Portal account, you will not receive any grade or attendance alerts that you may have set up. https://forms.gle/fJ4K9KfYu3V57uFN9

If you have any questions or concerns, please email Torie Ceynowa at tceynowa@simmsisd.net.

Thank you,
Torie Ceynowa, Counselor

post_text: Running concessions for multiple sports in the same season is a big job! Any help would be greatly appreciated!
shared_text:
Jeffrey McCullough
September 16, 2018 at 9:16 PM ·

Simms Parents

Can I get parents or adults that will volunteer to help with working the volleyball games or football games?

Volleyball games need three volunteers
JR. High and JV football games need 10 volunteers
High School games need minimum 15 volunteers

At this point I have certain parents working the majority of the games. I understand about work schedules and their daily lives but if each parent from JR. High to High School who has a child in sports or band volunteer to work just one game would make a huge difference.

Money raised by the concession stands is used for the Sports Department as well as Band activities. The sports banquet as well as scholarships are also provided by the Booster Club.

I would like to thank Siloam Baptist Church who brought a group of workers to Friday night’s football game. Thank y’all for your time.

Inbox me if you would like to volunteer. You can check the schedules at Simms Isd page for all games.

Go Pirates!!!

post_text: In our endzones this evening you may notice some diagonal lines. While our coaches do a great job making the field look great, they hold much more significance to us than just decoration.
shared_text:
Willy McDonald
August 31, 2018 at 2:00 PM ·

Pirate football field ready for tonight game against Union Grove. In the two end zone pictures we painted 9 lines in each end zone. The 9 lines added together equals 18 which is Scotty’s age. Each painted line is 30 degrees which represents Scottie’s jersey number. Pass the word around so the fans will know the importance of the end zone lines. Each Senior football player painted the lines.
